message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's symptoms suggest chronic tension-type headache, and amitriptyline therapy is an appropriate pharmacotherapy for this condition. Ergotamine therapy is more appropriate for acute migraine attacks, while aspirin therapy is more appropriate for acute pain relief. Valproate therapy is used for migraine prophylaxis, but not specifically for tension-type headaches.

Among the options, amitriptyline has been shown to be effective in preventing this type of headache. Ergotamine is used for migraines and aspirin is more commonly used for acute pain relief rather than prevention, while valproate is used for migraines and epilepsy.

Among the options, Amitriptyline therapy is most appropriate as it is a tricyclic antidepressant that can help with the patient’s stress and tension headaches. Ergotamine therapy is used for migraines, which the patient is not showing symptoms of, while Aspirin therapy may not be effective for chronic tension-type headache. Valproate therapy is used for migraines and other seizure disorders, but is not indicated for chronic tension-type headache.
